snippet: After years of contested goals, soccer’s pre-eminent lawmaking body approved the use of technology to decide whether a ball crosses the line.
abstract: International Football Assn Board recommends to FIFA, soccer's world governing body, that it allow the use of two technology systems--Hawk-Eye and GoalRef--to help determine if a ball crosses the goal line; systems could be put in place as early as the 2012-2013 season in England's Premier League and will certainly arrive in time for the 2014 World Cup in Brazil.
lead_paragraph: After years of contested goals, soccer’s pre-eminent lawmaking body approved the use of technology to decide whether a ball crosses the line.

headline.print_headline: Goal-Line Technology Approved, After Long Wait
